duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and improve manufacturing processes by analyzing product specifications and introducing continuous improvement initiatives.
Drive continuous improvement through process enhancements, automation, and cost reduction using Six Sigma principles and data-driven decision making.
Create Manufacturing Data Packages (MDPs) including assembly instructions, workflow, labor standards, and tool designs.
Provide technical support to manufacturers, troubleshoot processes, and lead corrective action investigations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum 2 years of prior relevant experience. The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. government issued security clearance is required.
Experience with automated tooling, machinery, and programming is preferred.
Proficiency with CAD solid modeling tools and technical drawing interpretation.
Hands-on mechanical aptitude with an innovative mindset for continuous improvement.
